title: Grilled Red Snapper With Strawberry And Avocado Salsa
summary: The recipe Grilled Red Snapper With Strawberry And Avocado Salsan is ready in about 45 minutes and is definitely a great caveman, gluten free, dairy free, and primal option for lovers of Mexican food. This recipe serves 4. For $1.72 per serving, this recipe covers 12% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. One serving contains 165 calories, 7g of protein, and 11g of fat. It will be a hit at your The Fourth Of July event. 47 people found this recipe to be flavorful and satisfying. If you have skin-on snapper fillets, onion, lime zest, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 93%. This score is amazing. Try strawberry avocado salsa with grilled salmon, Strawberry Avocado Salsa with Simply Grilled Chicken, and Seared Snapper with Mango Avocado Salsa for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Fish works really well with Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Grüner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. The Mark West Pinot Grigio with a 4.5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 13 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Mark West Pinot Grigio
productMatches.description:
Crisp and clean, this wine features honeydew, stone fruit, and citrus with a subtle, clean, lingering finish.
Try pairing with good old fish and chips, summer salads, and steamed clams by the dozen...or dozens.

instructions: In a medium bowl, stir together jalapeos, strawberries, onions, cilantro, lime juice, avocado and salt to make a salsa. Set aside.Preheat grill to medium heat. Meanwhile, combine oil and zest in a small bowl then brush all over fillets; season with salt and pepper. Grill fillets, skin side down and without flipping, until just cooked through and crisp around the edges, 8 to 10 minutes. Transfer to plates, remove and discard skin. Top with salsa and serve.

steps.step: In a medium bowl, stir together jalapeos, strawberries, onions, cilantro, lime juice, avocado and salt to make a salsa. Set aside.Preheat grill to medium heat. Meanwhile, combine oil and zest in a small bowl then brush all over fillets; season with salt and pepper. Grill fillets, skin side down and without flipping, until just cooked through and crisp around the edges, 8 to 10 minutes.
Transfer to plates, remove and discard skin. Top with salsa and serve.
